_header: For deathlike life my living death I wit
Subjects: lovers, death of; envoys; lover’s lament
_description: On the death of his mistress, by Charles d’Orléans — three 8-1ine stanzas and 4-line envoy

CULAdd2585.First Lines:
For ded i lif my lyv i deth y witeffor ese of payne in payne of ese
                    I die…
CULAdd2585.Last Lines:
…As y is noon of payn and heuenesO wooful wrecche o wrecche
                    lesse onys thi[ ]
CULAdd2585.Note:
From the flyleaves of a copy of the Sphaera of John de
                    Sacrobosco, MS M.11.62 (nineteenth-century note kept with MS).
CULAdd2585.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Some Charles d’Orleans Fragments.” 
             Modern Language Note
         66 (1951): 501-5: 504-5.

BLHar682.First Lines:
FOr dedy lijf my lyvy deth y witeffor ese of payne in payne of ese
                    y dye…
BLHar682.Last Lines: …Bot wolde y dey allas yet y ne may…
